messages.title: Let's Make Work Pay
messages.content: Labour will raise the minimum wage to £8 an hour over the next five years. We will also encourage employers to go further by offering tax breaks to businesses that pay the Living Wage.

messages.title: More Doctors, Nurses and Homecare Workers
messages.content: Labour created the NHS and it is our job to reinvigorate it again: Only Labour will bring in 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 extra GPs.

messages.title: Labour Will Back The Next Generation
messages.content: Under the Tories, almost 750,000 of our young people are out of work, and young people have suffered the biggest drop in wages under this Government.

messages.title: This Government has failed to tackle Britain's housing shortage
messages.content: Today it takes an average family 22 years to save for a deposit on a home, and the nine million people who rent privately are finding rent payments increasing faster than wages.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour plans to raise the minimum wage and to encourage businesses to pay the Living Wage by offering tax breaks.
Labour intends to reinvigorate the NHS by hiring 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 extra GPs.
To combat youth unemployment, Labour proposes to guarantee an apprenticeship for every school leaver who gets the basic grades.
Labour recognises the housing crisis and has set out a detailed plan to build 200,000 homes annually by 2020.

issues.economy: Labour plans to raise the minimum wage to £8 an hour and give tax breaks to businesses that pay the Living Wage.
issues.education: Labour promises every school leaver with basic grades an apprenticeship and smaller class sizes for five, six, and seven-year-olds.
issues.health: Labour commits to increasing NHS staff by adding 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 extra GPs.

housing.content: Labour has set out a detailed plan to build 200,000 homes annually by 2020.

politicalExperience.achievements: Lived in Honiton since 1991, work as a secondary school teacher, serve as a school governor and am a sitting Town Councillor.

images.caption: Labour's Parliamentary Candidate for Tiverton & Honiton - Caroline Kolek

leaflet.additionalNotes: Getting the best deal for Tiverton & Honiton. This Government isn't working for the majority of local people. We need to ease the pressure on our local hospitals. We need to fight for fairer funding for our schools.
